item.title: Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road Sales Reach 800k, Second Big Update Coming
item.content:encoded:
Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road has reached a new sales milestone, developer and publisher Level-5 has announced, and the game will be getting a second major update in the near future as well.

As revealed in a news post on the game's official website, Victory Road has racked up 800,000 sales since launching last November. The game managed to hit 500,000 sales in its first week, so that means it's picked up another 300,000 since then.

In addition to revealing the new sales milestone, Level-5 has also announced that a second major update is on the way for Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road, following on from the game's first big update in December. It's bringing "the opening of the Ares Route, among other features".

Level-5 will no doubt be pleased with Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road's performance, especially given what a long road it's been to get here (and not one with a guaranteed chance of victory, either).

Originally known as Inazuma Eleven: Heroes' Great Road, the game has been delayed numerous times, and a Western release was by no means guaranteed until Level-5 announced one in 2023.

Just like its predecessors, Victory Road is an RPG that combines tactical soccer battles with overworld exploration. It takes place around 25 years after the original Inazuma Eleven and follows a new protagonist, Dustin Billows (Sasanami Unmei in the Japanese version).

Billows isn't capable of hitting the field himself, but he can recruit other students to join his team, and so he serves as their commander, building a team of unconventional soccer heroes to take on all comers.

Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road forms part of what is arguably a big comeback for Level-5, with cozy RPG Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time also doing pretty well in the sales stakes.

You can check out Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road right now on PC, PlayStation, Xbox Series X|S, and both Switch 2 and Switch right now.
